intro: Hieracium smolandicum subsp. lossii, commonly known as the Sørensen's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. It features basal rosettes of leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species in its native range.
